title: 2025 Tata Tigor gets 360-degree camera, bigger infotainment screen
description: The 2025 Tata Tigor has been launched at Rs 5.99 lakh. Tata Motors' answer to the recently updated Dzire and Amaze, the Tigor, features mild styling tweaks, additional features, and tech in some variants. There are no mechanical changes for the 2025 model, meaning the compact sedan continues with the 1.2-litre petrol engine, along with a petrol-CNG option. Prices for the Tigor CNG start at Rs 7.70 lakh. The 2025 Tigor gets two new colour options It gets 10.25-inch infotainment screen, 360-degree camera It comes with a new interior shade, more creature comforts 2025 Tata Tigor features, tech details The 2025 Tigor, like the refreshed Tiago and the 2025 Nexon, gets mild styling tweaks on the outside. The grille and front bumper get minor design updates, and some variants feature a small bootlid spoiler. The alloy wheel design remains the same, but the hyperstyle wheel has an altered look. The interior theme is new, and all variants now come with the new illuminated steering wheel, with a dual-tone leather finish in higher trims. As for variant upgrades, the 2025 Tigor XT, priced at Rs 6.70 lakh, gets a 3.5-inch music system display, steering-mounted controls, follow-me-home headlamps, and other features. The Tigor XT CNG starts at Rs 7.70 lakh. The new Tigor XZ is priced at Rs 7.30 lakh for the petrol variant and gets LED headlamps with daytime running lamps, 15-inch hyperstyle wheels, individual front armrests, ESP, Hill Hold Control, a 7-inch infotainment screen with a reverse parking camera, as well as wired Android Auto and Apple CarPlay. The Tigor XZ CNG starts at Rs 8.30 lakh. The Tigor XZ+ comes with a freestanding 10.25-inch infotainment screen with an HD reverse camera, wireless Android Auto and Apple CarPlay, and a 4-inch digital instrument display. This variant is priced at Rs 7.90 lakh for the petrol version and Rs 8.90 lakh for the CNG. The top-spec 2025 Tigor XZ+ Lux gets all the new features of the XZ+ and adds a 360-degree camera, 15-inch alloy wheels, and rear A- and C-type charging ports. Prices for the Tigor XZ+ start at Rs 8.50 lakh for the petrol and Rs 9.50 lakh for the CNG. While Tata Motors has updated the Tigor and the Tigor CNG for 2025, there is no news on the Tigor EV getting any updates at the moment. Source
author: Akbar Merchant
